comments.body:
Could combine these two overloads using

```ts
declare function columns(data: columns.Data | ReadonlyArray<ReadonlyArray<any>>, ...
```

though I'm not sure if that makes the types any easier to use.
In fact, `ReadonlyArray<ReadonlyArray<any>>` fits signature of `columns.Data`, added it just for a hint to use arrays for `columns.Data`, should I just remove it?
Oh, true. I'm probably not the best person to ask which way is better. Probably depends on how confusing the second overload looks in code completion.

Is recommended to use union types: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/do-s-and-don-ts.html#use-union-types

Also put more specific types first (this is for overloads, I'm not sure if this will also apply for types): https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/do-s-and-don-ts.html#ordering
I'll merge as is. Any improvements could be handled by another PR.
